com.yantra.api.ycm

Interface createItem

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.YCMApi, YIFApi
    Deprecated. 
    Replaced by manageItem API as of Sterling Supply Chain Applications 7.9.

    public interface createItem

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document createItem(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      Deprecated. 
      The createItem API defines an Item and its attributes, aliases, service skills, exclusion codes, and additional attributes in a Catalog.

    • Method Detail

      • createItem

        org.w3c.dom.Document createItem(YFSEnvironment env,
                                org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                         throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                java.rmi.RemoteException
        Deprecated. 
        The createItem API defines an Item and its attributes, aliases, service skills, exclusion codes, and additional attributes in a Catalog. An item can only belong to one master catalog and it cannot be used across organizations.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits:
        This API invokes the following user exits:
        com.yantra.ycm.japi.ue.YCMValidateItemCreationUE

        Events Raised:
        The AFTER_CREATE_ITEM event for the ITEM_DEFINITION transaction is raised after successful creation of an item.
        Keydata is not published for this event. The XML published for this event can be found in the modify Item events XML file.

        Template Support: No

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        If a status is not passed, the item is created in the default status of 2000 - Held.

        Output Template Support: No

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment.
        inXML - Required. For more information, see the associated input xml files. and DTD input.
        Returns:
        Null.

        Throws:
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
